text: To touch a file is to simply create an empty file with that name.
Use notepad and save a file with the name with no contents in it, making sure that you are in the proper directory.
For an answer to why would you want the __init__.py file in the first place, see this question.

code:
> touch --help
Usage: touch [OPTION]... FILE...
Update the access and modification times of each FILE to the current time.

text: I recommend you get hold of GnuWin32, the GNU tools compiled for Windows, and then you can use the same commands as your guide.
Running Windows does not mean you cannot also use the command line like a *nix user.
Touch just creates a new empty text file with the name you specify.
I'm a linux guy but i might try this if I wanted a Windows command-line option.
You could always just right click in explorer to create a new text document.
Or save an empty text file in notepad.
I would recommend skimming through Zed Shaw's Learn the CLI the Hard Way, which provides his recommended way of interacting with the command-line for your platform.

childList.text: Learn the CLI the Hard Way

text: In the case of Windows, he recommends you use Powershell, which has the New-Item command:

code:
> cd temp
> New-Item iamcool.txt -type file
> ls


      Directory: C:\Users\zed\temp


  Mode                LastWriteTime     Length Name 
  ----                -------------     ------ ---- 
  d----        12/17/2011   9:03 AM            iamcool.txt
